indirect-pointer-tag.h

5#ifndef V8_SANDBOX_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_H_
6#define V8_SANDBOX_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_H_
7
8#include "src/common/globals.h"
9#include "src/objects/instance-type.h"
10
11namespace v8 {
12namespace internal {
13
14// Defines the list of valid indirect pointer tags.
15//
16// When accessing a trusted/indirect pointer, an IndirectPointerTag must be
17// provided which indicates the expected instance type of the pointed-to
18// object. When the sandbox is enabled, this tag is used to ensure type-safe
19// access to objects referenced via trusted pointers: if the provided tag
20// doesn't match the tag of the object in the trusted pointer table, an
21// inaccessible pointer will be returned.
22//
23// We use the shifted instance type as tag and an AND-based type-checking
24// mechanism in the TrustedPointerTable, similar to the one used by the
25// ExternalPointerTable: the entry in the table is ORed with the tag and then
26// ANDed with the inverse of the tag upon access. This has the benefit that the
27// type check and the removal of the marking bit can be folded into a single
28// bitwise operations. However, it is not technically guaranteed that simply
29// using the instance type as tag works for this scheme as the bits of one
30// instance type may happen to be a superset of those of another instance type,
31// thereby causing the type check to incorrectly pass. As such, the chance of
32// getting "incompabitle" tags increases when adding more tags here so we may
33// at some point want to consider manually assigning tag values that are
34// guaranteed to work (similar for how we do it for ExternalPointerTags).
35
36constexpr int kIndirectPointerTagShift = 48;
37constexpr uint64_t kIndirectPointerTagMask = 0x3fff000000000000;
38constexpr uint64_t kTrustedPointerTableMarkBit = 0x8000000000000000;
39constexpr uint64_t kTrustedPointerTableFreeEntryBit = 0x4000000000000000;
40
41#define INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_LIST(V) \
42 V(kCodeIndirectPointerTag, CODE_TYPE) \
43 V(kBytecodeArrayIndirectPointerTag, BYTECODE_ARRAY_TYPE) \
44 V(kInterpreterDataIndirectPointerTag, INTERPRETER_DATA_TYPE) \
45 IF_WASM(V, kWasmTrustedInstanceDataIndirectPointerTag, \
46 WASM_TRUSTED_INSTANCE_DATA_TYPE) \
47 IF_WASM(V, kWasmApiFunctionRefIndirectPointerTag, \
48 WASM_API_FUNCTION_REF_TYPE) \
49 IF_WASM(V, kWasmInternalFunctionIndirectPointerTag, \
50 WASM_INTERNAL_FUNCTION_TYPE) \
51 IF_WASM(V, kWasmFunctionDataIndirectPointerTag, WASM_FUNCTION_DATA_TYPE)
52
53#define MAKE_TAG(instance_type) \
54 (uint64_t{instance_type} << kIndirectPointerTagShift)
55
56// TODO(saelo): consider renaming this to something like TypeTag or
57// InstanceTypeTag since that better captures what this represents.
58enum IndirectPointerTag : uint64_t {
59 // The null tag. Usually used to express the lack of a valid tag, for example
60 // in non-sandbox builds.
61 kIndirectPointerNullTag = 0,
62
63 // This tag can be used when an indirect pointer field can legitimately refer
64 // to objects of different types.
65 // NOTE: this tag effectively disables the built-in type-checking mechanism.
66 // As such, in virtually all cases the caller needs to perform runtime-type
67 // checks (i.e. IsXyzObject(obj))` afterwards which need to be able to
68 // correctly handle unexpected types. The last point is worth stressing
69 // further. As an example, the following code is NOT correct:
70 //
71 // auto obj = LoadTrustedPointerField<kUnknownIndirectPointerTag>(...);
72 // if (IsFoo(obj)) {
73 // Foo::cast(obj)->foo();
74 // } else if (IsBar(obj)) {
75 // Bar::cast(obj)->bar();
76 // } else {
77 // // Potential type confusion here!
78 // Baz::cast(obj)->baz();
79 // }
80 //
81 // This is because an attacker can swap trusted pointers and thereby cause an
82 // object of a different/unexpected type to be returned. Instead, in this
83 // case a CHECK can for example be used to make the code correct:
84 //
85 // // ...
86 // } else {
87 // // Must be a Baz object
88 // CHECK(IsBaz(obj));
89 // Baz::cast(obj)->baz();
90 // }
91 //
92 kUnknownIndirectPointerTag = kIndirectPointerTagMask,
93
94 // Tag used internally by the trusted pointer table to mark free entries.
95 kFreeTrustedPointerTableEntryTag = kTrustedPointerTableFreeEntryBit,
96
97// "Regular" tags. One per supported instance type.
98#define INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_ENUM_DECL(name, instance_type) \
99 name = MAKE_TAG(instance_type),
100 INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_LIST(INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_ENUM_DECL)
101#undef INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_ENUM_DECL
102};
103
104#define VALIDATE_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG(name, instance_type) \
105 static_assert((name & kIndirectPointerTagMask) == name);
106INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_LIST(VALIDATE_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG)
107#undef VALIDATE_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG
108
109V8_INLINE constexpr bool IsValidIndirectPointerTag(IndirectPointerTag tag) {
110#define VALID_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_CASE(tag, instance_type) case tag:
111 switch (tag) {
112 INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_LIST(VALID_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_CASE)
113 return true;
114 default:
115 return false;
116 }
117#undef VALID_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_CASE
118}
119
120// Migrating objects into trusted space is typically performed in multiple
121// steps, where all references to the object from inside the sandbox are first
122// changed to indirect pointers before actually moving the object out of the
123// sandbox. As we have CHECKs that trusted pointer table entries point outside
124// of the sandbox, we need this helper function to disable that CHECK for
125// objects that are in the process of being migrated into trusted space.
126V8_INLINE constexpr bool IsTrustedSpaceMigrationInProgressForObjectsWithTag(
127 IndirectPointerTag tag) {
128 return false;
129}
130
131// The null tag is also considered an invalid tag since no indirect pointer
132// field should be using this tag.
133static_assert(!IsValidIndirectPointerTag(kIndirectPointerNullTag));
134
135V8_INLINE IndirectPointerTag
136IndirectPointerTagFromInstanceType(InstanceType instance_type) {
137 uint64_t raw = 0;
138 switch (instance_type) {
139#define CASE(name, instance_type) \
140 case instance_type: \
141 raw = MAKE_TAG(instance_type); \
142 break;
143 INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_LIST(CASE)
144#undef CASE
145#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
146 case WASM_EXPORTED_FUNCTION_DATA_TYPE:
147 case WASM_JS_FUNCTION_DATA_TYPE:
148 case WASM_CAPI_FUNCTION_DATA_TYPE:
149 // TODO(saelo): Consider adding support for inheritance hierarchies in
150 // our tag checking mechanism.
151 raw = kWasmFunctionDataIndirectPointerTag;
152 break;
153#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
154 default:
155 UNREACHABLE();
156 }
157 return static_cast<IndirectPointerTag>(raw);
158}
159
160V8_INLINE InstanceType
161InstanceTypeFromIndirectPointerTag(IndirectPointerTag tag) {
162 DCHECK(IsValidIndirectPointerTag(tag));
163 return static_cast<InstanceType>(tag >> kIndirectPointerTagShift);
164}
165
166#undef MAKE_TAG
167#undef INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_LIST
168
169} // namespace internal
170} // namespace v8
171
172#endif // V8_SANDBOX_INDIRECT_POINTER_TAG_H_
